'''Bagon''' ([[List of Japanese Pokémon names|Japanese]]: '''タツベイ''' ''Tatsubay'') is a {{type|Dragon}} {{OBP|Pokémon|species}} introduced in [[Generation III]].

It [[Evolution|evolves]] into {{p|Shelgon}} starting at [[level]] 30, which evolves into {{p|Salamence}} starting at [[level]] 50.

==Biology==
Bagon is a bipedal, blue, reptilian Pokémon vaguely resembling ''{{wp|Pachycephalosaurus}}''. It possesses a large, round snout, triangular eyes, yellow, circular ears similar to reptiles, and a yellow lower jaw with two teeth protruding upwards. Three thick, gray ridges cover the top of its head, and continue downwards to cover its neck as well. There is a triangular patch of yellow on its underside. It has stubby, digit-less arms and short legs with two toes on each foot.

Bagon lives in {{DL|List of Pokémon by habitat|Rough-terrain Pokémon|rough terrains}} with cliffs and rocks. It longs to fly and jumps off cliffs trying to be able to do so. Frustrated at its inability to fly, it leaps off cliffs and smashes its head against large rocks. This process of continually bashing its head causes it to become as hard as steel. Well-developed neck muscles support its hard head. This, combined with its powerful body, allows it to shatter rocks with its head.

==In the anime==
[[File:Sawyer Bagon.png|thumb|left|250px|Bagon in the {{pkmn|anime}}]]
===Major appearances===
Bagon debuted in ''[[AG043|Let Bagons be Bagons]]'', under the ownership of a {{pkmn|Trainer}} named [[Michelle]]. Throughout the episode, it tried to learn how to fly. It eventually evolved into a {{p|Shelgon}}.

In ''[[AG188|Pinch Healing]]'', a Bagon was being babysat by a Poké-Sitter named {{OBP|Matt|AG188}}. When it saw some {{p|Butterfree}} and {{p|Fearow}}, it wanted to {{m|fly}} as well. {{Ash}} and Matt were left to go find it when it wandered off while trying to learn how to fly. It eventually fell into a stream, where it was attacked by a school of {{p|Carvanha}}. After being rescued, Bagon was found to have a fever and was sent to the Pokémon Center, where it eventually healed.

A Bagon appeared in ''[[DP050|Tag! We're It...!]]'', where it participated in the [[Hearthome City Tag Battle Competition]]. It fought alongside a {{p|Yanma}} against [[Brock's Sudowoodo]] and [[Holly]]'s {{p|Wingull}}, but they were defeated.

A Bagon appeared in ''[[XY073|A Fashionable Battle!]]'', under the ownership of [[Sawyer]]. It was first used in a Gym battle against [[Valerie]], where it took on {{p|Spritzee}} but was defeated. Bagon reappeared in ''[[XY075|Rivals: Today and Tomorrow!]]'', where it was used in a battle against {{Ash}} and was defeated by {{AP|Hawlucha}}. It [[Evolution|evolved]] into {{p|Shelgon}} sometime before ''[[XY106|A Meeting of Two Journeys!]]'', and then into {{p|Salamence}} sometime before ''[[XY127|Analysis Versus Passion!]]''.

===Minor appearances===
A Bagon appeared in the opening sequence of ''[[M07|Destiny Deoxys]]''.

A Bagon appeared during the [[Hoenn Grand Festival]] in ''[[AG122|Deceit and Assist]]''.

A Bagon appeared in ''[[AG174|New Plot, Odd Lot!]]'', under the ownership of a {{pkmn|Coordinator}}.

A Bagon appeared in ''[[DP010|Not on MY Watch Ya Don't!]]''.

A Bagon appeared during the {{to|Floaroma}} {{pkmn|Contest}} in ''[[DP027|Settling a Not-So-Old Score!]]''.

A Bagon appeared in ''[[DP056|The Keystone Pops!]]''.

A Bagon appeared at the [[Pokémon Summer Academy]] in ''[[DP088|Camping It Up!]]''.

==Trivia==
* Bagon's {{stat|Special Defense}} is the lowest among {{type|Dragon}} Pokémon.

===Origin===
Bagon is based on a dragon, but possibly draws some aspects from ''{{wp|Pachycephalosaurus}}'', a species of two-legged dinosaur known for their domed heads.

====Name origin====
Bagon may be a combination of ''baby'' and ''dragon''.

Tatsubay may be a combination of 竜 ''tatsu'' (dragon) and ''baby''.
